p: Hence, weaving as a historical and relational pedagogy generates an inter-learning space that enables the interaction between different saberes and haceres, rooting them, problematizing them, questioning their assumptions and generating new ways to frame a given problematic. Unlike conventional pedagogies, the capacity to act does not rest on having full knowledge and control of the problem and the solution, but rather on the capacity to engage with uncertainty, singularity and conflict, and to recognize and deploy the social production of habitat as long and open-ended processes of dwelling that will continue to change over time.
